com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface printPickList

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface printPickList

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document printPickList(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      printPickList is used for printing a picklist.

    • Method Detail

      • printPickList

        org.w3c.dom.Document printPickList(YFSEnvironment env,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                   java.rmi.RemoteException

        printPickList is used for printing a picklist. A picklist is a hard copy document used for determining which items should put in the same container. It is generated for a ship node across one or more shipments and contains information on the shipment lines and the quantity for each line. Criteria (at different levels, for example Shipment, ShipmentLine, and Container ) may be specified based on which shipments need to be included in a picklist is determined. The number of shipments can be also specified in the input.

        The processing logic of the API is as follows:

        1. Carry out validations as specified within the Validations section
        2. Determine the transaction associated with the input document type which is a version of the base transaction PRINT_PICK_LIST.
        3. Determine the set of shipments eligible based on the pipeline pickup configuration, filtered by input criteria.
        4. For the requested number of shipments as specified in the NumberOfShipments attribute of <PickList> node (process all shipments if the number of shipments has not been specified), generate a new picklist number, as incremented from the DB sequence SEQ_YFS_PICK_LIST_NO. The input picklist number is used if the PickListNo attribute has been specified in <PickList> node). The shipments are marked with the picklist number.
        5. Call the changeShipmentStatus API (pass the shipment object and transaction_key) to change the status to the appropriate drop status for the transaction depending on the pipeline of each individual shipment and perform registerProcessCompletion. For more details, see the changeShipmentStatus API.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction PRINT_PICK_LIST.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of printPickList.
            Data published - YDM_PRINT_PICK_LIST.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            DTD - YDM_PRINT_PICK_LIST.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
            Key Data - pickList_dbd.txt

              Template Support: Yes

        Audits:
        An audit record is inserted into YFS_SHIPMENT_STATUS_AUDIT to indicate the change in shipment status for each shipment.

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions:
        A new picklist is generated. Shipments are stamped with this picklist number and their status changed according to the pipeline drop setup.

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the picklist and the shipments included in it. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
